trustfund:
TF035526-AFRICA REGION - URBAN
            DEVELOPMENT, MANAGEMENT,TF033946-AFRICA REGION - ENVIRONMENTAL
            ASSESSMENT AND CLIENT SUPPORT IN

abstracts.cdata!:
The project is rated unsatisfactory,
            sustainability is unlikely, and the ratings for both the
            Bank, and the Borrower's performances are
            unsatisfactory. Political instability hindered
            implementation, and even after implementation resumed in
            1991, senior staff changes, and weak contractors
            /consultants' work, resulted in unsatisfactory
            performances as well. Key lessons include: 1) the low
            economic rate of return, unsustainable cost recovery and
            institutional capacity, raised awareness of complex issues
            in project design, which, in an attempt to adjust to
            changing circumstances, the project proved useful in
            defining development programs - responsively - a concept not
            built-in project design. Likewise, the inability to achieve
            significant financial management and policy reforms, helped
            address these issues within a political context; 2)
            questions are raised on the Bank's comparative
            advantage in financing individual subprojects, and
            suggestions are, that given their high cost, the Bank should
            rather assist the client in building its own management
            capacity, to better concentrate on finance issues; 3)
            Decentralization requires analytical work, to undergo an
            unfolding process of incremental reforms, supported by
            investments, and capacity building. Strong ownership within
            local governments, and flexibility, should accompany the
            inextricable linkages sector wise, for broader economic growth.
